location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Summaries of official secret despatches from the Government of India and the Government of Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: The papers have been arranged into bundles tied with silk ribbons; each bundle summarises correspondence received on a given date. These bundles have been arranged in chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 112; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of summaries of official secret despatches from the Government of India and the Government of Bombay, relating to: Kashmir, Punjab, Nepal, Pegu, Crimea, Persia, Aden, Afghanistan, Turkey, Ava, Muscat, the Anglo-Afghan Treaty of Friendship (1855), and the Somali expedition.The date range gives the creation date of the summaries, but the summaries themselves refer to correspondence of an earlier date.
